author: Tom Rees
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is facing a £51 billion ($68 billion) shortfall to fill at the autumn budget, according to a prominent economic think tank that warned she will likely need to break Labour’s pledge not to raise major taxes.
title: Reeves Has a £51 Billion Fiscal Hole to Fill, UK Think Tank Says

author: Sherif Tarek
description: The Lebanese government commissioned the army to set out an action plan to keep all weapons in the war-weary country under state control by year’s end, a step that may ratchet up tensions between authorities and Iran-backed militant group Hezbollah.
title: Lebanon Asks Army to Plan Arms Control Despite Hezbollah’s Defiance

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump said Vice President JD Vance was “most likely” the heir-apparent to his Make America Great Again movement, but added there were also other potential candidates and that it was too early to make that call.
title: Trump Says JD Vance Is ‘Most Likely’ Heir to His Political Movement

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump suggested he would impose increased tariffs on additional countries buying energy from Russia — including China — after saying earlier Tuesday that he would raise levies on Indian exports within 24 hours.
title: Trump Says He’s Readying More Tariffs on Russian Energy Buyers

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump said he would make his decision on a replacement for outgoing Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler this week as he looks to make his imprint on the central bank’s monetary policy.
title: Trump Says He Will Decide on Fed Governor Before End of the Week

author: Catherine Lucey
description: Michigan Democratic Governor Gretchen Whitmer told President Donald Trump that his tariffs are having a negative effect on her state’s flagship auto industry during a closed-door meeting at the White House.
title: Michigan Governor Confronts Trump on Tariff Hit to Auto Industry

author: Erik Wasson
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson looks at the widening fight over House districts. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Texas Map Battle Threatens to Ignite a Multistate Free-for-All

author: Thomas Seal
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada will look for opportunities to remove some counter-tariffs against the US, despite winning an election in which he pledged to fight back against President Donald Trump’s trade war.
title: Canada Will Look at Opportunities to Remove Tariffs, Carney Says

author: Annie Massa
description: Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump will advise a new company that’s looking to take over a US-based manufacturer, the latest in a string of such positions for President Donald Trump’s eldest sons.
title: Trump Family-Advised SPAC Drops Mention of Seeking Government Perks

author: Laura Nahmias
description: Former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo shifted from his historically fierce defense of Israel, recalibrating his messaging ahead of New York City’s mayoral election after his defeat in the Democratic primary.
title: Cuomo Shifts Tone on Israel in NYC Campaign Revamp After Loss

author: Chris Strohm, Michael Shepard
description: Two Chinese nationals were arrested this week on charges that they sent tens of millions of dollars worth of advanced AI chips made by Nvidia Corp. to China in violation of US export restrictions, according to authorities.
title: US Charges Chinese Nationals With Nvidia Chips Export Breach

author: Chris Dolmetsch
description: Jeffrey Epstein’s former girlfriend and associate Ghislaine Maxwell is opposing the US Justice Department’s request to unseal grand jury transcripts in her criminal case, saying she is still fighting her conviction.
title: Ghislaine Maxwell Opposes Release of Epstein Case Documents

author: Catherine Lucey, Gregory Korte
description: The Trump administration will conclude a government-wide program started by Elon Musk requiring federal employees to summarize five workplace achievements from the prior week, according to the Office of Personnel Management.
title: Trump Administration Moves to End Musk’s ‘Five Things’ Email

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney promised as much as C$1.2 billion ($870 million) to shore up Canada’s lumber industry, which has been hit hard by US duties that are about to significantly increase.
title: Carney Pledges $870 Million for Lumber Sector Hit by Trump

author: Joe Lovinger, Erik Wasson, Miranda Davis
description: Democratic and Republican lawmakers are escalating their threats over redistricting, a fight that started in Texas and is now quickly spreading across the country.
title: Texas Vow to Arrest Democrats Spurs National Redistricting Clash

author: Priscila Azevedo Rocha
description: UK water regulator Ofwat said Chief Executive Officer David Black will step down at the end of August.
title: UK Water Regulator CEO Black to Step Down Ahead of Major Reforms

author: Anthony Halpin
description: The Kremlin is weighing options for a concession to US President Donald Trump that could include an air truce with Ukraine to try to head off the threat of secondary sanctions, even as Russia remains determined to continue its war.
title: Russia Weighs Ukraine Air-Truce Offer to Trump Without Ending War

author: Francesca Maglione, Nic Querolo, Amanda Albright
description: International students are struggling to secure visas as the Trump administration aggressively moves to curtail immigration, threatening college budgets across the US.
title: Trump’s Visa Havoc Strands Students Weeks Before Classes Start

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Lithuania called on its NATO allies to immediately help enhance its air defense capabilities, after two Russian military drones crossed into its airspace in less than a month.
title: Lithuania Asks NATO for Air Defense After Russian Drone Scare

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he had a “productive” phone call with Donald Trump as Russia ramped up its attacks, despite a deadline set by the US leader for Moscow to end its full-scale invasion.
title: Trump Holds Call With Zelenskiy as Truce Deadline to Putin Looms

author: Hugo Miller, Levin Stamm
description: The two-minute video isn’t subtle. Wielding a medieval halberd, the president of the conservative Swiss People’s Party lays out the choice Switzerland faces: a simpler life that the country’s founders spelled out in a one-page declaration more than 700 years ago or a 2,000 page treaty with the European Union.
title: Switzerland’s US Tariff Blow Threatens Its Go-It-Alone Approach

author: Arsalan Shahla
description: Iran’s President Masoud Pezeshkian appointed a veteran politician and former nuclear negotiator to lead the country’s Supreme National Security Council, the state-run Islamic Republic News Agency reported on Tuesday.
title: Iran Names Ali Larijani as New Head of Supreme Security Council

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has asked key defense and transport companies to come up with a plan on how to spend the money they’re about to receive as part of Europe’s push to ramp up its military capabilities.
title: Meloni Asks Defense Heavyweights for Plans to Spend EU Cash

author: Dan Williams, Galit Altstein
description: Israel is weighing an expansion of its armed presence in Gaza, even as military chiefs and a majority of the public oppose the idea out of concern for the fate of hostages still held by Hamas.
title: Israel Weighs Full Gaza Takeover Despite Concerns of Armed Forces

author: Arun Devnath, Swati Gupta
description: Bangladesh will hold national elections in February as the interim government comes under pressure to restore political stability following former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina’s shock ouster last year.
title: Bangladesh to Hold Elections in February, Yunus Announces

author: Chris Strohm
description: House Republicans subpoenaed the Justice Department, former President Bill Clinton and nearly a dozen other former federal officials for information about the late, disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein and his sex-trafficking operation.
title: House Panel Subpoenas Justice Department, Clintons on Epstein

author: Jim Wyss, Skylar Woodhouse
description: The White House has fired five of the seven board members of the federal watchdog that oversees Puerto Rico’s finances, as the group is engaged in high stakes debt and contract negotiations.
title: White House Fires Most of Puerto Rico’s Oversight Board Members

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Andrew Cuomo said that either he or Eric Adams will need to drop out of the race for New York mayor against Queens Assembly Member Zohran Mamdani by the middle of next month, otherwise the democratic socialist will defeat a divided field.
title: Cuomo Bets ‘Petrified’ New Yorkers Will Find Way to Beat Mamdani

author: Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Turkey plans to build industrial zones in Syria to develop the country’s war-ravaged economy and boost cross-border trade.
title: Turkey Seeks to Build Industrial Zones in Syria to Bolster Trade

author: Andra Timu
description: A Moldovan court sentenced the head of the autonomous region of Gagauzia to seven years in prison over illegal party funding tied to a fugitive oligarch.
title: Moldova Jails Pro-Russian Head of Autonomous Region Over Funding

author: Deena Shanker, Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: RFK Jr.’s MAHA coalition is already made up of unlikely GOP allies, from anti-Big Food activists to regenerative farmers. The issue of pesticides threatens to come between the movement and its Republican backers.
title: The GOP Is Choosing Pesticides Over the MAHA Moms

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: US President Donald Trump said he was “getting very close to a deal” with China to extend the trade truce that saw the two countries agree to reduce tit-for-tat tariff hikes and ease export restrictions on rare earth magnets and certain technologies.
title: Trump Says ‘Getting Very Close’ on Extending China Trade Truce

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he would raise tariffs on Indian goods “over the next 24 hours” in response to New Delhi’s continued purchases of Russian oil.
title: Trump Says He Will Hike India’s Tariffs Over ‘Next 24 Hours’

author: Michael Shepard
description: President Donald Trump said that US tariffs on semiconductor and pharmaceutical imports would be announced “within the next week or so,” as the administration prepares to target key economic sectors in its effort to remake global trade.
title: Trump Says Pharma, Chips Tariffs Coming in ‘Next Week or So’

author: Desire Nimubona
description: Burundi’s National Assembly has elected Nestor Ntahontuye as the new prime minister, just eight months after he was named finance minister.
title: Burundi Picks Finance Minister Ntahontuye as New Prime Minister

author: Gregory Korte, Shirin Ghaffary
description: The US government’s central purchasing arm is adding OpenAI, Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Anthropic to a list of approved artificial intelligence vendors, opening the door to widespread adoption of the technology across civilian federal agencies.
title: OpenAI, Google and Anthropic Win US Approval for Civilian AI Contracts

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: Reports of the Norwegian sovereign wealth fund’s investments in an Israeli company linked to the war in Gaza have triggered a political squabble in the Nordic country.
title: Norway Wealth Fund’s Investment in Israeli Company Sparks Backlash

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told him he didn’t want to be nominated to replace Jerome Powell as the next chair of the Federal Reserve.
title: Trump Says Bessent Doesn’t Want to Be Nominated as Fed Chair

author: Cam Kettles
description: Both US Senator John Cornyn and Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton are angling for an endorsement from Donald Trump in their already contentious and consequential primary campaign. But in a race that could ultimately determine control of the Senate in 2026, Trump is being uncharacteristically quiet.
title: Trump Lets His Friends Fight It Out Over Key Texas Senate Seat

author: Ruchi Bhatia, Shruti Srivastava, Swati Gupta
description: India’s government is scrambling to contain the economic fallout from President Donald Trump’s threatened tariff action, which has left officials in New Delhi reeling on how to respond.
title: India Shifts to Damage Control After Trump Ratchets Up Threats

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: Top aides for Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will travel to Russia on scheduled visits in the coming days, shortly after US President Donald Trump ramped up tariff threats over New Delhi’s close ties with Moscow, according to officials familiar with the matter.
title: Modi’s Top Aides to Visit Russia Despite Trump’s Tariff Threats

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland’s President Karin Keller-Sutter and Economy Minister Guy Parmelin will fly to the US on Tuesday to present a more attractive trade offer in a bid to lower a 39% tariff imposed by Washington.
title: Swiss President, Economy Minister to Fly to US for Talks

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Malaysia said a possible joint development with Indonesia in the Sulawesi Sea remains at the exploratory stage and nothing has been agreed by either side.
title: Malaysia Says Exploring Joint Development on Sulawesi Sea

author: Maria Eloisa Capurro, Jonnelle Marte
description: President Donald Trump’s relentless calls for dramatic reductions in interest rates, along with his ability to make changes to the Federal Reserve’s leadership, is drawing more attention to the way monetary policy decisions are made — and the people who make them.
title: Trump’s Fed Pick Could Face Resistance From Colleagues on Rates

author: Dan Strumpf
description: Beijing and New Delhi see each other as rivals but there are signs of thawing.
title: Trump’s India Feud May Open a Door for China

author: Julian Lee
description: Moscow’s biggest crude-buyer India faces punitive levies on goods exported to US
title: Russia's Oil Flow Steadies Ahead of Trump's Tariffs Onslaught

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon, Neil Jerome Morales
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. met in New Delhi on Tuesday and agreed to deepen their military partnership, at a time when China is becoming increasingly assertive in the Indian Ocean.
title: Modi, Marcos Pledge Closer Defense Ties Amid Rising China Threat

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s pledge to President Donald Trump of near-total market access for US goods includes key limits to protect some domestic industries, according to a government official, laying out the Southeast Asian nation’s terms for a tariff deal with Washington.
title: Thailand’s Zero Tariff Pledge to Trump Still Limits US Imports

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s cabinet approved the purchase of four Gripen fighter jets as part of a broader plan to modernize its military, days after its air force used the Swedish-made jets in a deadly border clash with neighboring Cambodia.
title: Thailand Clears Gripen Fighter Jets Order After Cambodia Clash

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: Indian officials have struggled to engage with President Donald Trump’s administration because key foreign policy roles in Washington remain unfilled, people familiar with the matter said, making it difficult for New Delhi to effectively push for a favorable trade deal.
title: Trump’s Staffing Gaps Complicate India’s Bid to Ease US Tensions

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: We look at the scenarios that could play out as the US and Israel consider their next steps.
title: What Is the World Going to Do About Iran’s Uranium?

author: Joe Lovinger, Erik Wasson
description: Missouri Republicans are mulling a redistricting plan similar to one taking shape in Texas that President Donald Trump has pushed to bolster the chances for the GOP to maintain control of Congress after the 2026 midterm elections.
title: Missouri Republicans Consider Joining Texas to Redraw House Maps
